description: Non Material Amendment to wording of Condition 19 (Travel Plan) of Planning Permission 19/01207/FUL (Alterations and extensions of existing student Seething Wells Campus to provide additional student accommodation and ancillary facilities. Rooftop extensions to existing buildings to provide 159 new student rooms, alterations to Listed Buildings to provide a café, flexible meeting and recreation spaces and other ancillary facilities)
decision_conditions: It is considered that the proposed amendments may result in a material change to planning permission 19/01207/FUL. The Travel Plan Monitoring Reports are required on an annual basis in order to ensure that sustainable transport methods are encouraged and implemented in accordance with Policies CS5 (Reducing the Need to Travel) and CS6 (Sustainable Travel) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Informative:The applicant is advised to arrange with Highways for a highway condition survey to be undertaken prior to commencement of any construction as they will be liable in full for any costs incurred in remedying damage to the highway (including footway and crossover) as a consequence of the construction activity. As part of the survey the Highways Inspector may advise that a strengthening of the footway/crossover is required which would again be at the applicant's cost.

Please be advised that a fee of either £145 or £250 is required for this application. This can be paid either online at www.kingston.gov.uk or by calling our Customer Service Team on 020 8547 5002The amount due will be whether you want written advice, or an online meeting (£145 each) or both £250Please confirm and make payment accordingly
